content.body: Are there any pending changes/proposals to do with the way streams work?
content.formatted_body: Are there any pending changes/proposals to do with the way streams work?

content.body: I don't think this is what you mean, but https://github.com/whatwg/streams/pull/1283 added transformer.cancel, which hasn't been shipped in any major browser.
Not what I was hoping for
content.formatted_body: Not what I was hoping for

content.body: Being more specific would help people answer your question better. there are probably all kinds of stream-related proposals/issues on github that you could search or propose new ones
Is there a structure guide somewhere on proposing new ones?
content.formatted_body: Is there a structure guide somewhere on proposing new ones?

content.body: What I'd like to change is to allow transform streams to be byob

https://github.com/whatwg/streams/issues
"New Issue" has a few templates
... and you can search the existing list in that URL

Hi, I am told to ping [Domenic](https://matrix.to/#/@domenicdenicola:matrix.org) about this in the Ladybird chat, so I hope that’s ok.
Does this in the WebIDL spec essentially mean that extended attributes are allowed on both sides of the `required` keyword for dictionary members?
To me it seems the linked spec below can be expanded to `ExtendedAttributeList required TypeWithExtendedAttributes identifier ;`
 https://webidl.spec.whatwg.org/#prod-DictionaryMember
content.formatted_body:
Hi, I am told to ping Domenic about this in the Ladybird chat, so I hope that’s ok.
Does this in the WebIDL spec essentially mean that extended attributes are allowed on both sides of the required keyword for dictionary members?
To me it seems the linked spec below can be expanded to ExtendedAttributeList required TypeWithExtendedAttributes identifier ;
https://webidl.spec.whatwg.org/#prod-DictionaryMember

content.body: Aron het Lam: that seems correct, but I suspect it also means you could have `[X] [X] Type ident;` in theory, which is also a bit weird.
content.formatted_body: Aron het Lam: that seems correct, but I suspect it also means you could have [X] [X] Type ident; in theory, which is also a bit weird.
